page.title: 10Eastover Farm.
page.content: Eastover Farm is rented from Lady Boughey by the John Read Partnership. 1600 acres are used for growing crops, 210 acres for animals and 5 acres for buildings and machinery. They employ seven men on the farm. In 1985 they are growing 1200 tonnes of Wheat, 1000 tonnes of Barley, 100 tonnes of rape, 77 tonnes of peas and 68 tonnes of beans. They are harvested between July and September. They are dried and cleaned before transferring to lorries. They are then sent to other E.E.C. countries. The farm has both beef and dairy cattle. A local dealer takes the beef cattle. The dairy cattle, mainly of Friesian stock, are milked twice a day by machine. Twenty five cows are slaughtered each year. During the winter they are kept in sheds.
